parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and luo; to loosen down, i.e. to demolish; specially to halt for the night.
